typedef mapvector< Node *, dof_id_type >::veclike_iterator node_iterator_imp
 
typedef mapvector< Node *, dof_id_type >::const_veclike_iterator const_node_iterator_imp
 

Detailed Description

The DistributedMesh class is derived from the MeshBase class, and is intended to provide identical functionality to the user but be distributed rather than replicated across distributed-memory systems.

Definition at line 45 of file distributed_mesh.h.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef mapvector<Elem *, dof_id_type>::const_veclike_iterator libMesh::DistributedMesh::const_elem_iterator_imp
private

Definition at line 520 of file distributed_mesh.h.

typedef mapvector<Elem *, dof_id_type>::veclike_iterator libMesh::DistributedMesh::elem_iterator_imp
private

Typedefs for the container implementation. In this case, it's just a std::vector<Elem *>.

Definition at line 512 of file distributed_mesh.h.

typedef mapvector<Node *, dof_id_type>::veclike_iterator libMesh::DistributedMesh::node_iterator_imp
private

Typedefs for the container implementation. In this case, it's just a std::vector<Node *>.

Definition at line 519 of file distributed_mesh.h.

typedef Predicates::multi_predicate libMesh::MeshBase::Predicate
inherited

We need an empty, generic class to act as a predicate for this and derived mesh classes.

Definition at line 822 of file mesh_base.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

libMesh::DistributedMesh::DistributedMesh ( const Parallel::Communicator &  comm_in,
unsigned char  dim = 1 
)
explicit

Constructor. Takes dim, the dimension of the mesh. The mesh dimension can be changed (and may automatically be changed by mesh generation/loading) later.

Referenced by clone().

libMesh::DistributedMesh::DistributedMesh ( unsigned char  dim = 1)
explicit

Deprecated constructor. Takes dim, the dimension of the mesh. The mesh dimension can be changed (and may automatically be changed by mesh generation/loading) later.

libMesh::DistributedMesh::DistributedMesh ( const UnstructuredMesh &  other_mesh)

Copy-constructor. This should be able to take a replicated or distributed mesh.

Definition at line 126 of file distributed_mesh.C.

References libMesh::MeshBase::_next_unique_id, libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::copy_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_boundary_info(), libMesh::MeshBase::parallel_max_unique_id(), and update_parallel_id_counts().

126  :
127  UnstructuredMesh (other_mesh), _is_serial(other_mesh.is_serial()),
128  _n_nodes(0), _n_elem(0), _max_node_id(0), _max_elem_id(0),
129  _next_free_local_node_id(this->processor_id()),
130  _next_free_local_elem_id(this->processor_id()),
131  _next_free_unpartitioned_node_id(this->n_processors()),
132  _next_free_unpartitioned_elem_id(this->n_processors())
133 {
134  this->copy_nodes_and_elements(other_mesh);
135  this->get_boundary_info() = other_mesh.get_boundary_info();

139 #endif

Member Function Documentation

virtual element_iterator libMesh::DistributedMesh::active_elements_begin ( )
virtual

Active, local, and negation forms of the element iterators described above. An "active" element is an element without children (i.e. has not been refined). A "local" element is one whose processor_id() matches the current processor.

Implements libMesh::MeshBase.

virtual const_element_iterator libMesh::DistributedMesh::active_elements_begin ( ) const
virtual

Implements libMesh::MeshBase.

virtual element_iterator libMesh::DistributedMesh::active_elements_end ( )

Implements libMesh::MeshBase.

Elem * libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_elem ( Elem *  e)
virtual

Add elem e to the end of the element array. To add an element locally, set e->processor_id() before adding it. To ensure a specific element id, call e->set_id() before adding it; only do this in parallel if you are manually keeping ids consistent.

Users should call MeshBase::prepare_for_use() after elements are added to and/or deleted from the mesh.

Implements libMesh::MeshBase.

Definition at line 406 of file distributed_mesh.C.

References _elements, _max_elem_id, _n_elem, _next_free_local_elem_id, _next_free_unpartitioned_elem_id, libMesh::MeshBase::_next_unique_id, _next_unpartitioned_unique_id, libMesh::DofObject::id(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_processor_id, is_serial(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), std::max(), libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::set_id(), libMesh::DofObject::set_unique_id(), libMesh::DofObject::valid_id(), and libMesh::DofObject::valid_unique_id().

Referenced by add_extra_ghost_elem().

407 {
408  // Don't try to add NULLs!
409  libmesh_assert(e);
410 
411  // Trying to add an existing element is a no-op
412  if (e->valid_id() && _elements[e->id()] == e)
413  return e;
414 
415  const processor_id_type elem_procid = e->processor_id();
416 
417  if (!e->valid_id())
418  {
419  // We should only be creating new ids past the end of the range
420  // of existing ids
421  libmesh_assert_greater_equal(_next_free_unpartitioned_elem_id,
422  _max_elem_id);
423  libmesh_assert_greater_equal(_next_free_local_elem_id, _max_elem_id);
424 
425  // Use the unpartitioned ids for unpartitioned elems,
426  // in serial, and temporarily for ghost elems
427  dof_id_type * next_id = &_next_free_unpartitioned_elem_id;
428  if (elem_procid == this->processor_id() &&
429  !this->is_serial())
430  next_id = &_next_free_local_elem_id;
431  e->set_id (*next_id);
432  }
433 
434  {
435  // Advance next_ids up high enough that each is pointing to an
436  // unused id and any subsequent increments will still point us
437  // to unused ids
438  _max_elem_id = std::max(_max_elem_id,
439  static_cast<dof_id_type>(e->id()+1));
440 
441  if (_next_free_unpartitioned_elem_id < _max_elem_id)
442  _next_free_unpartitioned_elem_id =
443  ((_max_elem_id-1) / (this->n_processors() + 1) + 1) *
444  (this->n_processors() + 1) + this->n_processors();
445  if (_next_free_local_elem_id < _max_elem_id)
446  _next_free_local_elem_id =
447  ((_max_elem_id + this->n_processors() - 1) / (this->n_processors() + 1) + 1) *
448  (this->n_processors() + 1) + this->processor_id();
449 
450 #ifndef NDEBUG
451  // We need a const mapvector so we don't inadvertently create
452  // NULL entries when testing for non-NULL ones
453  const mapvector<Elem *, dof_id_type> & const_elements = _elements;
454 #endif
455  libmesh_assert(!const_elements[_next_free_unpartitioned_elem_id]);
456  libmesh_assert(!const_elements[_next_free_local_elem_id]);
457  }
458 
459  // Don't try to overwrite existing elems
460  libmesh_assert (!_elements[e->id()]);
461 
462  _elements[e->id()] = e;
463 
464  // Try to make the cached elem data more accurate
465  if (elem_procid == this->processor_id() ||
466  elem_procid == DofObject::invalid_processor_id)
467  _n_elem++;
468 
469 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
470  if (!e->valid_unique_id())
471  {
472  if (processor_id() == e->processor_id())
473  {
474  e->set_unique_id() = _next_unique_id;
475  _next_unique_id += this->n_processors() + 1;
476  }
477  else
478  {
479  e->set_unique_id() = _next_unpartitioned_unique_id;
480  _next_unpartitioned_unique_id += this->n_processors() + 1;
481  }
482  }
483 #endif
484 
485  // Unpartitioned elems should be added on every processor
486  // And shouldn't be added in the same batch as ghost elems
487  // But we might be just adding on processor 0 to
488  // broadcast later
489  // #ifdef DEBUG
490  // if (elem_procid == DofObject::invalid_processor_id)
491  // {
492  // dof_id_type elem_id = e->id();
493  // this->comm().max(elem_id);
494  // libmesh_assert_equal_to (elem_id, e->id());
495  // }
496  // #endif
497 
498  return e;
499 }

void libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_extra_ghost_elem ( Elem *  e)
virtual

Inserts the element and adds it to a list of elements not to get deleted by delete_remote_elements. This is handy for inserting off-processor elements that you want to keep track of on this processor.

Definition at line 1415 of file distributed_mesh.C.

References _extra_ghost_elems, and add_elem().

1416 {
1417  // First add the elem like normal
1418  add_elem(e);
1419 
1420  // Now add it to the set that won't be deleted when we call
1421  // delete_remote_elements()
1422  _extra_ghost_elems.insert(e);
1423 }
libMesh::DistributedMesh::_extra_ghost_elems
std::set< Elem * > _extra_ghost_elems

libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_elem
virtual Elem * add_elem(Elem *e) libmesh_override
Definition: distributed_mesh.C:406
void libMesh::MeshBase::add_ghosting_functor ( GhostingFunctor &  ghosting_functor)
inlineinherited

Adds a functor which can specify ghosting requirements for use on distributed meshes. Multiple ghosting functors can be added; any element which is required by any functor will be ghosted.

GhostingFunctor memory must be managed by the code which calls this function; the GhostingFunctor lifetime is expected to extend until either the functor is removed or the Mesh is destructed.

Definition at line 721 of file mesh_base.h.

References libMesh::MeshBase::_ghosting_functors.

722  { _ghosting_functors.insert(&ghosting_functor); }
libMesh::MeshBase::_ghosting_functors
std::set< GhostingFunctor * > _ghosting_functors
Definition: mesh_base.h:1322
Node * libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_node ( Node *  n)
virtual

Add Node n to the end of the vertex array.

Implements libMesh::MeshBase.

606  // Don't try to add NULLs!
607  libmesh_assert(n);

611  return n;
612

614

616  {
617  // We should only be creating new ids past the end of the range
618  // of existing ids
619  libmesh_assert_greater_equal(_next_free_unpartitioned_node_id,
620  _max_node_id);
621  libmesh_assert_greater_equal(_next_free_local_node_id, _max_node_id);

623  // Use the unpartitioned ids for unpartitioned nodes,
624  // in serial, and temporarily for ghost nodes
625  dof_id_type * next_id = &_next_free_unpartitioned_node_id;
626  if (node_procid == this->processor_id() &&
627  !this->is_serial())
628  next_id = &_next_free_local_node_id;

630  }
631 
632  {
633  // Advance next_ids up high enough that each is pointing to an
634  // unused id and any subsequent increments will still point us
635  // to unused ids
636  _max_node_id = std::max(_max_node_id,
637  static_cast<dof_id_type>(n->id()+1));
638 
639  if (_next_free_unpartitioned_node_id < _max_node_id)
640  _next_free_unpartitioned_node_id =
641  ((_max_node_id-1) / (this->n_processors() + 1) + 1) *
642  (this->n_processors() + 1) + this->n_processors();
643  if (_next_free_local_node_id < _max_node_id)
644  _next_free_local_node_id =
645  ((_max_node_id + this->n_processors() - 1) / (this->n_processors() + 1) + 1) *
646  (this->n_processors() + 1) + this->processor_id();
647 
648 #ifndef NDEBUG
649  // We need a const mapvector so we don't inadvertently create
650  // NULL entries when testing for non-NULL ones
651  const mapvector<Node *,dof_id_type> & const_nodes = _nodes;
652 #endif
653  libmesh_assert(!const_nodes[_next_free_unpartitioned_node_id]);
654  libmesh_assert(!const_nodes[_next_free_local_node_id]);
655  }
656 
657  // Don't try to overwrite existing nodes
658  libmesh_assert (!_nodes[n->id()]);
659 
660  _nodes[n->id()] = n;
661 
662  // Try to make the cached node data more accurate
663  if (node_procid == this->processor_id() ||
664  node_procid == DofObject::invalid_processor_id)
665  _n_nodes++;
666 
667 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
668  if (!n->valid_unique_id())
669  {
670  if (processor_id() == n->processor_id())
671  {
672  n->set_unique_id() = _next_unique_id;
673  _next_unique_id += this->n_processors();
674  }
675  else
676  {
677  n->set_unique_id() = _next_unpartitioned_unique_id;
678  _next_unpartitioned_unique_id += this->n_processors() + 1;
679  }
680  }
681 #endif
682 
683 
684  // Unpartitioned nodes should be added on every processor
685  // And shouldn't be added in the same batch as ghost nodes
686  // But we might be just adding on processor 0 to
687  // broadcast later
688  // #ifdef DEBUG
689  // if (node_procid == DofObject::invalid_processor_id)
690  // {
691  // dof_id_type node_id = n->id();
692  // this->comm().max(node_id);
693  // libmesh_assert_equal_to (node_id, n->id());
694  // }
695  // #endif
696 
697  return n;
698 }

libMesh::libmesh_assert
libmesh_assert(remote_elem)
libMesh::Node::build
static UniquePtr< Node > build(const Node &n)
Definition: node.h:286
libMesh::DistributedMesh::add_node
virtual Node * add_node(Node *n) libmesh_override
Definition: distributed_mesh.C:604
libMesh::DistributedMesh::_nodes
mapvector< Node *, dof_id_type > _nodes
Definition: distributed_mesh.h:467
void libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::all_first_order ( )
virtualinherited

Converts a mesh with higher-order elements into a mesh with linear elements. For example, a mesh consisting of Tet10 will be converted to a mesh with Tet4 etc.

Prepare to identify (and then delete) a bunch of no-longer-used nodes.

Loop over the high-ordered elements. First make sure they are indeed high-order, and then replace them with an equivalent first-order element.

If the second order element had any boundary conditions they should be transfered to the first-order element. The old boundary conditions will be removed from the BoundaryInfo data structure by insert_elem.

Implements libMesh::MeshBase.

Definition at line 302 of file mesh_modification.C.

References libMesh::MeshBase::_is_prepared, libMesh::Elem::add_child(), libMesh::Elem::build(), libMesh::Elem::child_ptr(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::copy_boundary_ids(), libMesh::MeshBase::delete_node(), libMesh::MeshBase::elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::elements_end(), libMesh::Elem::first_order_equivalent_type(), libMesh::MeshBase::get_boundary_info(), libMesh::Elem::has_children(), libMesh::DofObject::id(), libMesh::MeshBase::insert_elem(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshBase::max_node_id(), libMesh::Elem::n_children(), libMesh::Elem::n_sides(), libMesh::Elem::n_vertices(), libMesh::Elem::neighbor(), libMesh::Elem::neighbor_ptr(), libMesh::Elem::node_id(), libMesh::Elem::node_ptr(), libMesh::MeshBase::nodes_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::nodes_end(), libMesh::Elem::p_level(), libMesh::Elem::p_refinement_flag(), libMesh::Elem::parent(), libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::Elem::refinement_flag(), libMesh::remote_elem, libMesh::MeshBase::renumber_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::Elem::replace_child(), libMesh::DofObject::set_id(), libMesh::Elem::set_neighbor(), libMesh::Elem::set_node(), libMesh::Partitioner::set_node_processor_ids(), libMesh::Elem::set_p_level(), libMesh::Elem::set_p_refinement_flag(), libMesh::Elem::set_parent(), libMesh::Elem::set_refinement_flag(), libMesh::DofObject::set_unique_id(), libMesh::Elem::subdomain_id(), libMesh::Elem::type(), libMesh::DofObject::unique_id(), and libMesh::Elem::which_child_am_i().

303 {
304  /*
305  * when the mesh is not prepared,
306  * at least renumber the nodes and
307  * elements, so that the node ids
308  * are correct
309  */
310  if (!this->_is_prepared)
311  this->renumber_nodes_and_elements ();
312 
313  START_LOG("all_first_order()", "Mesh");
314 
318  std::vector<bool> node_touched_by_me(this->max_node_id(), false);
319 
325  element_iterator endit = elements_end();
326  for (element_iterator it = elements_begin();
327  it != endit; ++it)
328  {
329  Elem * so_elem = *it;
330 
331  libmesh_assert(so_elem);
332 
333  /*
334  * build the first-order equivalent, add to
335  * the new_elements list.
336  */
337  Elem * lo_elem = Elem::build
338  (Elem::first_order_equivalent_type
339  (so_elem->type()), so_elem->parent()).release();
340 
341  for (unsigned int s=0; s != so_elem->n_sides(); ++s)
342  if (so_elem->neighbor_ptr(s) == remote_elem)
343  lo_elem->set_neighbor(s, const_cast<RemoteElem *>(remote_elem));
344 
345 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
346  /*
347  * Reset the parent links of any child elements
348  */
349  if (so_elem->has_children())
350  for (unsigned int c=0; c != so_elem->n_children(); ++c)
351  {
352  so_elem->child_ptr(c)->set_parent(lo_elem);
353  lo_elem->add_child(so_elem->child_ptr(c), c);
354  }
355 
356  /*
357  * Reset the child link of any parent element
358  */
359  if (so_elem->parent())
360  {
361  unsigned int c =
362  so_elem->parent()->which_child_am_i(so_elem);
363  lo_elem->parent()->replace_child(lo_elem, c);
364  }
365 
366  /*
367  * Copy as much data to the new element as makes sense
368  */
369  lo_elem->set_p_level(so_elem->p_level());
370  lo_elem->set_refinement_flag(so_elem->refinement_flag());
371  lo_elem->set_p_refinement_flag(so_elem->p_refinement_flag());
372 #endif
373 
374  libmesh_assert_equal_to (lo_elem->n_vertices(), so_elem->n_vertices());
375 
376  /*
377  * By definition the vertices of the linear and
378  * second order element are identically numbered.
379  * transfer these.
380  */
381  for (unsigned int v=0; v < so_elem->n_vertices(); v++)
382  {
383  lo_elem->set_node(v) = so_elem->node_ptr(v);
384  node_touched_by_me[lo_elem->node_id(v)] = true;
385  }
386 
387  /*
388  * find_neighbors relies on remote_elem neighbor links being
389  * properly maintained.
390  */
391  for (unsigned short s=0; s<so_elem->n_sides(); s++)
392  {
393  if (so_elem->neighbor(s) == remote_elem)
394  lo_elem->set_neighbor(s, const_cast<RemoteElem*>(remote_elem));
395  }
396 
403  this->get_boundary_info().copy_boundary_ids
404  (this->get_boundary_info(), so_elem, lo_elem);
405 
406  /*
407  * The new first-order element is ready.
408  * Inserting it into the mesh will replace and delete
409  * the second-order element.
410  */
411  lo_elem->set_id(so_elem->id());
412 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
413  lo_elem->set_unique_id() = so_elem->unique_id();
414 #endif
415  lo_elem->processor_id() = so_elem->processor_id();
416  lo_elem->subdomain_id() = so_elem->subdomain_id();
417  this->insert_elem(lo_elem);
418  }
419 
420  const MeshBase::node_iterator nd_end = this->nodes_end();
421  MeshBase::node_iterator nd = this->nodes_begin();
422  while (nd != nd_end)
423  {
424  Node * the_node = *nd;
425  ++nd;
426  if (!node_touched_by_me[the_node->id()])
427  this->delete_node(the_node);
428  }
429 
430  STOP_LOG("all_first_order()", "Mesh");
431 
432  // On hanging nodes that used to also be second order nodes, we
433  // might now have an invalid nodal processor_id()
434  Partitioner::set_node_processor_ids(*this);
435 
436  // delete or renumber nodes, etc
437  this->prepare_for_use(/*skip_renumber =*/ false);
438 }

libMesh::MeshBase::_is_prepared
bool _is_prepared
Definition: mesh_base.h:1242
libMesh::MeshBase::max_node_id
virtual dof_id_type max_node_id() const =0
libMesh::Elem::first_order_equivalent_type
static ElemType first_order_equivalent_type(const ElemType et)
Definition: elem.C:2573
libMesh::MeshBase::renumber_nodes_and_elements
virtual void renumber_nodes_and_elements()=0
libMesh::remote_elem
const RemoteElem * remote_elem
Definition: remote_elem.C:57
void libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::all_second_order ( const bool  full_ordered = true)
virtualinherited

Converts a (conforming, non-refined) mesh with linear elements into a mesh with second-order elements. For example, a mesh consisting of Tet4 will be converted to a mesh with Tet10 etc. Note that for some elements like Hex8 there exist two higher order equivalents, Hex20 and Hex27. When full_ordered is true (default), then Hex27 is built. Otherwise, Hex20 is built. The same holds obviously for Quad4, Prism6 ...

Loop over the low-ordered elements in the elements vector. First make sure they _are indeed low-order, and then replace them with an equivalent second-order element. Don't forget to delete the low-order element, or else it will leak!

If the linear element had any boundary conditions they should be transfered to the second-order element. The old boundary conditions will be removed from the BoundaryInfo data structure by insert_elem.

Also, prepare_for_use() will reconstruct most of our neighbor links, but if we have any remote_elem links in a distributed mesh, they need to be preserved. We do that in the same loop here.

Implements libMesh::MeshBase.

Definition at line 442 of file mesh_modification.C.

References libMesh::MeshBase::_is_prepared, libMesh::MeshBase::add_point(), libMesh::Elem::build(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::copy_boundary_ids(), libMesh::Elem::default_order(), libMesh::MeshBase::elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::elements_end(), libMesh::FIRST, libMesh::MeshBase::get_boundary_info(), libMesh::DofObject::id(), libMesh::MeshBase::insert_elem(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id, libMesh::MeshBase::is_serial(), libMesh::Elem::level(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshCommunication::make_new_nodes_parallel_consistent(), libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::max(), libMesh::MeshBase::mesh_dimension(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_elem(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_nodes(), libMesh::Elem::n_sides(), libMesh::Elem::n_vertices(), libMesh::Elem::neighbor(), libMesh::Elem::node_ptr(), libMesh::MeshBase::node_ref(), libMesh::MeshBase::point(), libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::Real, libMesh::remote_elem, libMesh::MeshBase::renumber_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::MeshBase::reserve_nodes(), libMesh::Elem::second_order_equivalent_type(), libMesh::Elem::subdomain_id(), libMesh::Elem::type(), and libMesh::DofObject::unique_id().

Referenced by libMesh::MeshTools::Generation::build_cube().

443 {
444  // This function must be run on all processors at once
445  parallel_object_only();
446 
447  /*
448  * when the mesh is not prepared,
449  * at least renumber the nodes and
450  * elements, so that the node ids
451  * are correct
452  */
453  if (!this->_is_prepared)
454  this->renumber_nodes_and_elements ();
455 
456  /*
457  * If the mesh is empty
458  * then we have nothing to do
459  */
460  if (!this->n_elem())
461  return;
462 
463  /*
464  * If the mesh is already second order
465  * then we have nothing to do.
466  * We have to test for this in a round-about way to avoid
467  * a bug on distributed parallel meshes with more processors
468  * than elements.
469  */
470  bool already_second_order = false;
471  if (this->elements_begin() != this->elements_end() &&
472  (*(this->elements_begin()))->default_order() != FIRST)
473  already_second_order = true;
474  this->comm().max(already_second_order);
475  if (already_second_order)
476  return;
477 
478  START_LOG("all_second_order()", "Mesh");
479 
480  /*
481  * this map helps in identifying second order
482  * nodes. Namely, a second-order node:
483  * - edge node
484  * - face node
485  * - bubble node
486  * is uniquely defined through a set of adjacent
487  * vertices. This set of adjacent vertices is
488  * used to identify already added higher-order
489  * nodes. We are safe to use node id's since we
490  * make sure that these are correctly numbered.
491  */
492  std::map<std::vector<dof_id_type>, Node *> adj_vertices_to_so_nodes;
493 
494  /*
495  * for speed-up of the \p add_point() method, we
496  * can reserve memory. Guess the number of additional
497  * nodes for different dimensions
498  */
499  switch (this->mesh_dimension())
500  {
501  case 1:
502  /*
503  * in 1D, there can only be order-increase from Edge2
504  * to Edge3. Something like 1/2 of n_nodes() have
505  * to be added
506  */
507  this->reserve_nodes(static_cast<unsigned int>
508  (1.5*static_cast<double>(this->n_nodes())));
509  break;
510 
511  case 2:
512  /*
513  * in 2D, either refine from Tri3 to Tri6 (double the nodes)
514  * or from Quad4 to Quad8 (again, double) or Quad9 (2.25 that much)
515  */
516  this->reserve_nodes(static_cast<unsigned int>
517  (2*static_cast<double>(this->n_nodes())));
518  break;
519 
520 
521  case 3:
522  /*
523  * in 3D, either refine from Tet4 to Tet10 (factor = 2.5) up to
524  * Hex8 to Hex27 (something > 3). Since in 3D there _are_ already
525  * quite some nodes, and since we do not want to overburden the memory by
526  * a too conservative guess, use the lower bound
527  */
528  this->reserve_nodes(static_cast<unsigned int>
529  (2.5*static_cast<double>(this->n_nodes())));
530  break;
531 
532  default:
533  // Hm?
534  libmesh_error_msg("Unknown mesh dimension " << this->mesh_dimension());
535  }
536 
537 
538 
539  /*
540  * form a vector that will hold the node id's of
541  * the vertices that are adjacent to the son-th
542  * second-order node. Pull this outside of the
543  * loop so that silly compilers don't repeatedly
544  * create and destroy the vector.
545  */
546  std::vector<dof_id_type> adjacent_vertices_ids;
547 
554  element_iterator
555  it = elements_begin(),
556  endit = elements_end();
557 
558  for (; it != endit; ++it)
559  {
560  // the linear-order element
561  Elem * lo_elem = *it;
562 
563  libmesh_assert(lo_elem);
564 
565  // make sure it is linear order
566  if (lo_elem->default_order() != FIRST)
567  libmesh_error_msg("ERROR: This is not a linear element: type=" << lo_elem->type());
568 
569  // this does _not_ work for refined elements
570  libmesh_assert_equal_to (lo_elem->level (), 0);
571 
572  /*
573  * build the second-order equivalent, add to
574  * the new_elements list. Note that this here
575  * is the only point where \p full_ordered
576  * is necessary. The remaining code works well
577  * for either type of seconrd-order equivalent, e.g.
578  * Hex20 or Hex27, as equivalents for Hex8
579  */
580  Elem * so_elem =
581  Elem::build (Elem::second_order_equivalent_type(lo_elem->type(),
582  full_ordered) ).release();
583 
584  libmesh_assert_equal_to (lo_elem->n_vertices(), so_elem->n_vertices());
585 
586 
587  /*
588  * By definition the vertices of the linear and
589  * second order element are identically numbered.
590  * transfer these.
591  */
592  for (unsigned int v=0; v < lo_elem->n_vertices(); v++)
593  so_elem->set_node(v) = lo_elem->node_ptr(v);
594 
595  /*
596  * Now handle the additional mid-side nodes. This
597  * is simply handled through a map that remembers
598  * the already-added nodes. This map maps the global
599  * ids of the vertices (that uniquely define this
600  * higher-order node) to the new node.
601  * Notation: son = second-order node
602  */
603  const unsigned int son_begin = so_elem->n_vertices();
604  const unsigned int son_end = so_elem->n_nodes();
605 
606 
607  for (unsigned int son=son_begin; son<son_end; son++)
608  {
609  const unsigned int n_adjacent_vertices =
610  so_elem->n_second_order_adjacent_vertices(son);
611 
612  adjacent_vertices_ids.resize(n_adjacent_vertices);
613 
614  for (unsigned int v=0; v<n_adjacent_vertices; v++)
615  adjacent_vertices_ids[v] =
616  so_elem->node_id( so_elem->second_order_adjacent_vertex(son,v) );
617 
618  /*
619  * \p adjacent_vertices_ids is now in order of the current
620  * side. sort it, so that comparisons with the
621  * \p adjacent_vertices_ids created through other elements'
622  * sides can match
623  */
624  std::sort(adjacent_vertices_ids.begin(),
625  adjacent_vertices_ids.end());
626 
627 
628  // does this set of vertices already has a mid-node added?
629  std::pair<std::map<std::vector<dof_id_type>, Node *>::iterator,
630  std::map<std::vector<dof_id_type>, Node *>::iterator>
631  pos = adj_vertices_to_so_nodes.equal_range (adjacent_vertices_ids);
632 
633  // no, not added yet
634  if (pos.first == pos.second)
635  {
636  /*
637  * for this set of vertices, there is no
638  * second_order node yet. Add it.
639  *
640  * compute the location of the new node as
641  * the average over the adjacent vertices.
642  */
643  Point new_location = this->point(adjacent_vertices_ids[0]);
644  for (unsigned int v=1; v<n_adjacent_vertices; v++)
645  new_location += this->point(adjacent_vertices_ids[v]);
646 
647  new_location /= static_cast<Real>(n_adjacent_vertices);
648 
649  /* Add the new point to the mesh, giving it a globally
650  * well-defined processor id.
651  */
652  Node * so_node = this->add_point
653  (new_location, DofObject::invalid_id,
654  this->node_ref(adjacent_vertices_ids[0]).processor_id());
655 
656  /*
657  * insert the new node with its defining vertex
658  * set into the map, and relocate pos to this
659  * new entry, so that the so_elem can use
660  * \p pos for inserting the node
661  */
662  adj_vertices_to_so_nodes.insert(pos.first,
663  std::make_pair(adjacent_vertices_ids,
664  so_node));
665 
666  so_elem->set_node(son) = so_node;
667  }
668  // yes, already added.
669  else
670  {
671  libmesh_assert(pos.first->second);
672 
673  so_elem->set_node(son) = pos.first->second;
674  }
675  }
676 
677  /*
678  * find_neighbors relies on remote_elem neighbor links being
679  * properly maintained.
680  */
681  for (unsigned short s=0; s<lo_elem->n_sides(); s++)
682  {
683  if (lo_elem->neighbor(s) == remote_elem)
684  so_elem->set_neighbor(s, const_cast<RemoteElem*>(remote_elem));
685  }
686 
698  this->get_boundary_info().copy_boundary_ids
699  (this->get_boundary_info(), lo_elem, so_elem);
700 
701  /*
702  * The new second-order element is ready.
703  * Inserting it into the mesh will replace and delete
704  * the first-order element.
705  */
706  so_elem->set_id(lo_elem->id());
707 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
708  so_elem->set_unique_id() = lo_elem->unique_id();
709 #endif
710  so_elem->processor_id() = lo_elem->processor_id();
711  so_elem->subdomain_id() = lo_elem->subdomain_id();
712  this->insert_elem(so_elem);
713  }
714 
715  // we can clear the map
716  adj_vertices_to_so_nodes.clear();
717 
718 
719  STOP_LOG("all_second_order()", "Mesh");
720 
721  // In a DistributedMesh our ghost node processor ids may be bad,
722  // the ids of nodes touching remote elements may be inconsistent,
723  // and unique_ids of newly added non-local nodes remain unset.
724  // make_new_nodes_parallel_consistent() will fix all this.
725  if (!this->is_serial())
726  MeshCommunication().make_new_nodes_parallel_consistent (*this);
727 
728  // renumber nodes, elements etc
729  this->prepare_for_use(/*skip_renumber =*/ false);
730 }
libMesh::MeshBase::get_boundary_info
const BoundaryInfo & get_boundary_info() const
Definition: mesh_base.h:114
libMesh::MeshBase::reserve_nodes
virtual void reserve_nodes(const dof_id_type nn)=0

Definition: elem.C:234
libMesh::libmesh_assert
libmesh_assert(remote_elem)
libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::max
void max(T &r) const
Definition: parallel_implementation.h:1723
libMesh::MeshBase::node_ref
virtual const Node & node_ref(const dof_id_type i) const
Definition: mesh_base.h:375
libMesh::MeshBase::add_point
virtual Node * add_point(const Point &p, const dof_id_type id=DofObject::invalid_id, const processor_id_type proc_id=DofObject::invalid_processor_id)=0
libMesh::MeshBase::elements_begin
virtual element_iterator elements_begin()=0
libMesh::MeshBase::elements_end
virtual element_iterator elements_end()=0
libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id
static const dof_id_type invalid_id
Definition: dof_object.h:335
libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use
void prepare_for_use(const bool skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements=false, const bool skip_find_neighbors=false)
Definition: mesh_base.C:172
libMesh::Elem::second_order_equivalent_type
static ElemType second_order_equivalent_type(const ElemType et, const bool full_ordered=true)

void libMesh::MeshBase::allow_remote_element_removal ( bool  allow)
inlineinherited

If false is passed in then this mesh will no longer have remote elements deleted when being prepared for use; i.e. even a DistributedMesh will remain (if it is already) serialized. This may adversely affect performance and memory use.

Definition at line 694 of file mesh_base.h.

void libMesh::MeshBase::allow_renumbering ( bool  allow)
inlineinherited

If false is passed in then this mesh will no longer be renumbered when being prepared for use. This may slightly adversely affect performance during subsequent element access, particulary when using a distributed mesh.

void libMesh::MeshBase::cache_elem_dims ( )
inherited

Search the mesh and cache the different dimenions of the elements present in the mesh. This is done in prepare_for_use(), but can be done manually by other classes after major mesh modifications.

Definition at line 592 of file mesh_base.C.

References libMesh::MeshBase::_elem_dims, libMesh::MeshBase::_spatial_dimension, libMesh::MeshBase::active_elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::active_elements_end(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), end, libMesh::MeshBase::mesh_dimension(), libMesh::MeshBase::node(), libMesh::MeshBase::nodes_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::nodes_end(), and libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::set_union().

Referenced by libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use().

593 {
594  // This requires an inspection on every processor
595  parallel_object_only();
596 
597  // Need to clear _elem_dims first in case all elements of a
598  // particular dimension have been deleted.
599  _elem_dims.clear();
600 
601  const_element_iterator el = this->active_elements_begin();
602  const_element_iterator end = this->active_elements_end();
603 
604  for (; el!=end; ++el)
605  _elem_dims.insert((*el)->dim());
606 
607  // Some different dimension elements may only live on other processors
608  this->comm().set_union(_elem_dims);
609 
610  // If the largest element dimension found is larger than the current
611  // _spatial_dimension, increase _spatial_dimension.
612  unsigned int max_dim = this->mesh_dimension();
613  if (max_dim > _spatial_dimension)
614  _spatial_dimension = cast_int<unsigned char>(max_dim);
615 
616  // _spatial_dimension may need to increase from 1->2 or 2->3 if the
617  // mesh is full of 1D elements but they are not x-aligned, or the
618  // mesh is full of 2D elements but they are not in the x-y plane.
619  // If the mesh is x-aligned or x-y planar, we will end up checking
620  // every node's coordinates and not breaking out of the loop
621  // early...
622  if (_spatial_dimension < 3)
623  {
624  const_node_iterator node_it = this->nodes_begin();
625  const_node_iterator node_end = this->nodes_end();
626  for (; node_it != node_end; ++node_it)
627  {
628  Node & node = **node_it;
629 
630 #if LIBMESH_DIM > 1
631  // Note: the exact floating point comparison is intentional,
632  // we don't want to get tripped up by tolerances.
633  if (node(1) != 0.)
634  {
635  _spatial_dimension = 2;
636 #if LIBMESH_DIM == 2
637  // If libmesh is compiled in 2D mode, this is the
638  // largest spatial dimension possible so we can break
639  // out.
640  break;
641 #endif
642  }
643 #endif
644 
645 #if LIBMESH_DIM > 2
646  if (node(2) != 0.)
647  {
648  // Spatial dimension can't get any higher than this, so
649  // we can break out.
650  _spatial_dimension = 3;
651  break;
652  }
653 #endif
654  }
655  }
656 }
end
IterBase * end

bool libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::contract ( )
virtualinherited

Delete subactive (i.e. children of coarsened) elements. This removes all elements descended from currently active elements in the mesh.

Implements libMesh::MeshBase.

Definition at line 770 of file unstructured_mesh.C.

References libMesh::Elem::active(), libMesh::Elem::ancestor(), libMesh::MeshBase::clear_point_locator(), libMesh::Elem::contract(), libMesh::MeshBase::delete_elem(), libMesh::MeshBase::elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::elements_end(), end, libMesh::MeshBase::ghosting_functors_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::ghosting_functors_end(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libmesh_nullptr, libMesh::GhostingFunctor::mesh_reinit(), libMesh::Elem::parent(), libMesh::MeshBase::renumber_nodes_and_elements(), and libMesh::Elem::subactive().

771 {
772  LOG_SCOPE ("contract()", "Mesh");
773 
774  // Flag indicating if this call actually changes the mesh
775  bool mesh_changed = false;
776 
777  element_iterator in = elements_begin();
778  const element_iterator end = elements_end();
779 
780 #ifdef DEBUG
781  for ( ; in != end; ++in)
782  if (*in != libmesh_nullptr)
783  {
784  Elem * el = *in;
785  libmesh_assert(el->active() || el->subactive() || el->ancestor());
786  }
787  in = elements_begin();
788 #endif
789 
790  // Loop over the elements.
791  for ( ; in != end; ++in)
792  if (*in != libmesh_nullptr)
793  {
794  Elem * el = *in;
795 
796  // Delete all the subactive ones
797  if (el->subactive())
798  {
799  // No level-0 element should be subactive.
800  // Note that we CAN'T test elem->level(), as that
801  // touches elem->parent()->dim(), and elem->parent()
802  // might have already been deleted!
803  libmesh_assert(el->parent());
804 
805  // Delete the element
806  // This just sets a pointer to NULL, and doesn't
807  // invalidate any iterators
808  this->delete_elem(el);
809 
810  // the mesh has certainly changed
811  mesh_changed = true;
812  }
813  else
814  {
815  // Compress all the active ones
816  if (el->active())
817  el->contract();
818  else
819  libmesh_assert (el->ancestor());
820  }
821  }
822 
823  // Strip any newly-created NULL voids out of the element array
824  this->renumber_nodes_and_elements();
825 
826  // FIXME: Need to understand why deleting subactive children
827  // invalidates the point locator. For now we will clear it explicitly
828  this->clear_point_locator();
829 
830  // Allow our GhostingFunctor objects to reinit if necessary.
831  std::set<GhostingFunctor *>::iterator gf_it = this->ghosting_functors_begin();
832  const std::set<GhostingFunctor *>::iterator gf_end = this->ghosting_functors_end();
833  for (; gf_it != gf_end; ++gf_it)
834  {
835  GhostingFunctor *gf = *gf_it;
836  libmesh_assert(gf);
837  gf->mesh_reinit();
838  }
839 
840  return mesh_changed;
841 }

76 {
77  // We're assuming our subclass data needs no copy
78  libmesh_assert_equal_to (_n_parts, other_mesh._n_parts);
79  libmesh_assert_equal_to (_is_prepared, other_mesh._is_prepared);
80 
81  // We're assuming the other mesh has proper element number ordering,
82  // so that we add parents before their children.
83 #ifdef DEBUG
84  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_amr_elem_ids(other_mesh);
85 #endif
86 
87  //Copy in Nodes
88  {
89  //Preallocate Memory if necessary
90  this->reserve_nodes(other_mesh.n_nodes());
91 
92  const_node_iterator it = other_mesh.nodes_begin();
93  const_node_iterator end = other_mesh.nodes_end();
94 
95  for (; it != end; ++it)
96  {
97  const Node * oldn = *it;
98 
99  // Add new nodes in old node Point locations
100 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
101  Node *newn =
102 #endif
103  this->add_point(*oldn, oldn->id(), oldn->processor_id());
104 
105 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
106  newn->set_unique_id() = oldn->unique_id();
107 #endif
108  }
109  }
110 
111  //Copy in Elements
112  {
113  //Preallocate Memory if necessary
114  this->reserve_elem(other_mesh.n_elem());
115 
116  // Declare a map linking old and new elements, needed to copy the neighbor lists
117  std::map<const Elem *, Elem *> old_elems_to_new_elems;
118 
119  // Loop over the elements
120  MeshBase::const_element_iterator it = other_mesh.elements_begin();
121  const MeshBase::const_element_iterator end = other_mesh.elements_end();
122 
123  // FIXME: Where do we set element IDs??
124  for (; it != end; ++it)
125  {
126  //Look at the old element
127  const Elem * old = *it;
128  //Build a new element
129  Elem * newparent = old->parent() ?
130  this->elem_ptr(old->parent()->id()) : libmesh_nullptr;
131  UniquePtr<Elem> ap = Elem::build(old->type(), newparent);
132  Elem * el = ap.release();
133 
134  el->subdomain_id() = old->subdomain_id();
135 
136  for (unsigned int s=0; s != old->n_sides(); ++s)
137  if (old->neighbor_ptr(s) == remote_elem)
138  el->set_neighbor(s, const_cast<RemoteElem *>(remote_elem));
139 
140 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
141  if (old->has_children())
142  for (unsigned int c=0; c != old->n_children(); ++c)
143  if (old->child_ptr(c) == remote_elem)
144  el->add_child(const_cast<RemoteElem *>(remote_elem), c);
145 
146  //Create the parent's child pointers if necessary
147  if (newparent)
148  {
149  unsigned int oldc = old->parent()->which_child_am_i(old);
150  newparent->add_child(el, oldc);
151  }
152 
153  // Copy the refinement flags
154  el->set_refinement_flag(old->refinement_flag());
155 
156  // Use hack_p_level since we may not have sibling elements
157  // added yet
158  el->hack_p_level(old->p_level());
159 
160  el->set_p_refinement_flag(old->p_refinement_flag());
161 #endif // #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
162 
163  //Assign all the nodes
164  for(unsigned int i=0;i<el->n_nodes();i++)
165  el->set_node(i) = this->node_ptr(old->node_id(i));
166 
167  // And start it off in the same subdomain
168  el->processor_id() = old->processor_id();
169 
170  // Give it the same ids
171  el->set_id(old->id());
172 
173 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
174  el->set_unique_id() = old->unique_id();
175 #endif
176 
177  //Hold onto it
178  if(!skip_find_neighbors)
179  {
180  this->add_elem(el);
181  }
182  else
183  {
184  Elem * new_el = this->add_elem(el);
185  old_elems_to_new_elems[old] = new_el;
186  }
187 
188  // Add the link between the original element and this copy to the map
189  if(skip_find_neighbors)
190  old_elems_to_new_elems[old] = el;
191  }
192 
193  // Loop (again) over the elements to fill in the neighbors
194  if(skip_find_neighbors)
195  {
196  it = other_mesh.elements_begin();
197  for (; it != end; ++it)
198  {
199  Elem * old_elem = *it;
200  Elem * new_elem = old_elems_to_new_elems[old_elem];
201  for (unsigned int s=0; s != old_elem->n_neighbors(); ++s)
202  {
203  const Elem * old_neighbor = old_elem->neighbor_ptr(s);
204  Elem * new_neighbor = old_elems_to_new_elems[old_neighbor];
205  new_elem->set_neighbor(s, new_neighbor);
206  }
207  }
208  }
209  }
210 
211  //Finally prepare the new Mesh for use. Keep the same numbering and
212  //partitioning but also the same renumbering and partitioning
213  //policies as our source mesh.
214  this->allow_renumbering(false);
215  this->skip_partitioning(true);
216  this->prepare_for_use(false, skip_find_neighbors);
217  this->allow_renumbering(other_mesh.allow_renumbering());
218  this->skip_partitioning(other_mesh.skip_partitioning());
219 }

Generates a new mesh containing all the elements which are assigned to processor pid. This mesh is written to the pid_mesh reference which you must create and pass to the function.

Constructs a mesh called "new_mesh" from the current mesh by iterating over the elements between it and it_end and adding them to the new mesh.

Definition at line 689 of file unstructured_mesh.C.

Definition: id_types.h:64
void libMesh::DistributedMesh::delete_elem ( Elem *  e)
virtual

Removes element e from the mesh. Note that calling this method may produce isolated nodes, i.e. nodes not connected to any element. This method must be implemented in derived classes in such a way that it does not invalidate element iterators.

Users should call MeshBase::prepare_for_use() after elements are added to and/or deleted from the mesh.

Implements libMesh::MeshBase.

Definition at line 537 of file distributed_mesh.C.

References _elements, _n_elem, libMesh::MeshBase::get_boundary_info(), libMesh::DofObject::id(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_processor_id, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libmesh_nullptr, libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), and libMesh::BoundaryInfo::remove().

Referenced by libMesh::MeshCommunication::delete_remote_elements(), and insert_elem().

539  libmesh_assert (e);

542  processor_id_type elem_procid = e->processor_id();
543  if (elem_procid == this->processor_id() ||
544  elem_procid == DofObject::invalid_processor_id)
545  _n_elem--;
546 
547  // Delete the element from the BoundaryInfo object
548  this->get_boundary_info().remove(e);
549

551  // an iterator that way!
552 
553  //_elements.erase(e->id());
554 
555  // Instead, we set it to NULL for now
556 
557  _elements[e->id()] = libmesh_nullptr;
558 
559  // delete the element
560  delete e;
561 }

714  // Try to make the cached elem data more accurate
715  processor_id_type node_procid = n->processor_id();
716  if (node_procid == this->processor_id() ||
717  node_procid == DofObject::invalid_processor_id)
718  _n_nodes--;
719 
720  // Delete the node from the BoundaryInfo object
721  this->get_boundary_info().remove(n);
722 
723  // But not yet from the container; we might invalidate
724  // an iterator that way!
725 
726  //_nodes.erase(n->id());
727 
728  // Instead, we set it to NULL for now
729 
730  _nodes[n->id()] = libmesh_nullptr;
731 
732  // delete the node
733  delete n;
734 }

Deletes all nonlocal elements of the mesh except for "ghosts" which touch a local element, and deletes all nodes which are not part of a local or ghost element

void libMesh::MeshBase::detect_interior_parents ( )
inherited

Search the mesh for elements that have a neighboring element of dim+1 and set that element as the interior parent

Definition at line 658 of file mesh_base.C.

References libMesh::MeshBase::active_elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::active_elements_end(), libMesh::Elem::dim(), libMesh::MeshBase::elem(), libMesh::MeshBase::elem_dimensions(), libMesh::MeshBase::elem_ptr(), libMesh::MeshBase::elem_ref(), libMesh::MeshBase::elements_begin(), end, libMesh::DofObject::id(), libMesh::Elem::interior_parent(), libMesh::MeshBase::max_elem_id(), libMesh::Elem::n_vertices(), libMesh::Elem::node_id(), and libMesh::Elem::set_interior_parent().

Referenced by libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use().

659 {
660  // This requires an inspection on every processor
661  parallel_object_only();
662 
663  // Check if the mesh contains mixed dimensions. If so, then set interior parents, otherwise return.
664  if (this->elem_dimensions().size() == 1)
665  return;
666 
667  //This map will be used to set interior parents
668  LIBMESH_BEST_UNORDERED_MAP<dof_id_type, std::vector<dof_id_type> > node_to_elem;
669 
670  const_element_iterator el = this->active_elements_begin();
671  const_element_iterator end = this->active_elements_end();
672 
673  for (; el!=end; ++el)
674  {
675  const Elem * elem = *el;
676 
677  // Populating the node_to_elem map, same as MeshTools::build_nodes_to_elem_map
678  for (unsigned int n=0; n<elem->n_vertices(); n++)
679  {
680  libmesh_assert_less (elem->id(), this->max_elem_id());
681 
682  node_to_elem[elem->node_id(n)].push_back(elem->id());
683  }
684  }
685 
686  // Automatically set interior parents
687  el = this->elements_begin();
688  for (; el!=end; ++el)
689  {
690  Elem * element = *el;
691 
692  // Ignore an 3D element or an element that already has an interior parent
693  if (element->dim()>=LIBMESH_DIM || element->interior_parent())
694  continue;
695 
696  // Start by generating a SET of elements that are dim+1 to the current
697  // element at each vertex of the current element, thus ignoring interior nodes.
698  // If one of the SET of elements is empty, then we will not have an interior parent
699  // since an interior parent must be connected to all vertices of the current element
700  std::vector< std::set<dof_id_type> > neighbors( element->n_vertices() );
701 
702  bool found_interior_parents = false;
703 
704  for (dof_id_type n=0; n < element->n_vertices(); n++)
705  {
706  std::vector<dof_id_type> & element_ids = node_to_elem[element->node_id(n)];
707  for (std::vector<dof_id_type>::iterator e_it = element_ids.begin();
708  e_it != element_ids.end(); e_it++)
709  {
710  dof_id_type eid = *e_it;
711  if (this->elem_ref(eid).dim() == element->dim()+1)
712  neighbors[n].insert(eid);
713  }
714  if (neighbors[n].size()>0)
715  {
716  found_interior_parents = true;
717  }
718  else
719  {
720  // We have found an empty set, no reason to continue
721  // Ensure we set this flag to false before the break since it could have
722  // been set to true for previous vertex
723  found_interior_parents = false;
724  break;
725  }
726  }
727 
728  // If we have successfully generated a set of elements for each vertex, we will compare
729  // the set for vertex 0 will the sets for the vertices until we find a id that exists in
730  // all sets. If found, this is our an interior parent id. The interior parent id found
731  // will be the lowest element id if there is potential for multiple interior parents.
732  if (found_interior_parents)
733  {
734  std::set<dof_id_type> & neighbors_0 = neighbors[0];
735  for (std::set<dof_id_type>::iterator e_it = neighbors_0.begin();
736  e_it != neighbors_0.end(); e_it++)
737  {
738  found_interior_parents=false;
739  dof_id_type interior_parent_id = *e_it;
740  for (dof_id_type n=1; n < element->n_vertices(); n++)
741  {
742  if (neighbors[n].find(interior_parent_id)!=neighbors[n].end())
743  {
744  found_interior_parents=true;
745  }
746  else
747  {
748  found_interior_parents=false;
749  break;
750  }
751  }
752  if (found_interior_parents)
753  {
754  element->set_interior_parent(this->elem_ptr(interior_parent_id));
755  break;
756  }
757  }
758  }
759  }
760 }

Implements libMesh::MeshBase.

void libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::find_neighbors ( const bool  reset_remote_elements = false,
const bool  reset_current_list = true 
)
virtualinherited

Other functions from MeshBase requiring re-definition.

Here we look at all of the child elements which don't already have valid neighbors.

If a child element has a NULL neighbor it is either because it is on the boundary or because its neighbor is at a different level. In the latter case we must get the neighbor from the parent.

If a child element has a remote_elem neighbor on a boundary it shares with its parent, that info may have become out-dated through coarsening of the neighbor's parent. In this case, if the parent's neighbor is active then the child should share it.

Furthermore, that neighbor better be active, otherwise we missed a child somewhere.

We also need to look through children ordered by increasing refinement level in order to add new interior_parent() links in boundary elements which have just been generated by refinement, and fix links in boundary elements whose previous interior_parent() has just been coarsened away.

Implements libMesh::MeshBase.

Definition at line 234 of file unstructured_mesh.C.

References libMesh::TypeVector< T >::absolute_fuzzy_equals(), libMesh::Elem::active(), libMesh::Elem::ancestor(), libMesh::Elem::centroid(), libMesh::Elem::child_ptr(), libMesh::Elem::dim(), libMesh::MeshBase::elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::elements_end(), end, libMesh::err, libMesh::Elem::has_children(), libMesh::Elem::hmin(), libMesh::DofObject::id(), libMesh::Elem::interior_parent(), libMesh::Elem::is_child_on_side(), libMesh::Elem::key(), libMesh::Elem::level(), libMesh::MeshBase::level_elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::level_elements_end(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_amr_interior_parents(), libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_neighbors(), libmesh_nullptr, libMesh::Elem::n_children(), libMesh::MeshTools::n_levels(), libMesh::Elem::n_neighbors(), libMesh::Elem::n_nodes(), libMesh::Elem::neighbor_ptr(), libMesh::Elem::parent(), libMesh::Elem::point(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::Real, libMesh::remote_elem, libMesh::Elem::set_interior_parent(), libMesh::Elem::set_neighbor(), libMesh::Elem::side_ptr(), libMesh::Elem::subactive(), libMesh::TOLERANCE, libMesh::Elem::which_child_am_i(), and libMesh::NameBasedIO::write().

Referenced by libMesh::TriangleWrapper::copy_tri_to_mesh(), and redistribute().

236 {
237  // We might actually want to run this on an empty mesh
238  // (e.g. the boundary mesh for a nonexistant bcid!)
239  // libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (this->n_nodes(), 0);
240  // libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (this->n_elem(), 0);
241 
242  // This function must be run on all processors at once
243  parallel_object_only();
244 
245  LOG_SCOPE("find_neighbors()", "Mesh");
246 
247  const element_iterator el_end = this->elements_end();
248 
249  //TODO:[BSK] This should be removed later?!
250  if (reset_current_list)
251  for (element_iterator el = this->elements_begin(); el != el_end; ++el)
252  {
253  Elem * e = *el;
254  for (unsigned int s=0; s<e->n_neighbors(); s++)
255  if (e->neighbor_ptr(s) != remote_elem ||
256  reset_remote_elements)
257  e->set_neighbor(s, libmesh_nullptr);
258  }
259 
260  // Find neighboring elements by first finding elements
261  // with identical side keys and then check to see if they
262  // are neighbors
263  {
264  // data structures -- Use the hash_multimap if available
265  typedef unsigned int key_type;
266  typedef std::pair<Elem *, unsigned char> val_type;
267  typedef std::pair<key_type, val_type> key_val_pair;
268 
269  typedef LIBMESH_BEST_UNORDERED_MULTIMAP<key_type, val_type> map_type;
270 
271  // A map from side keys to corresponding elements & side numbers
272  map_type side_to_elem_map;
273 
274 
275 
276  for (element_iterator el = this->elements_begin(); el != el_end; ++el)
277  {
278  Elem * element = *el;
279 
280  for (unsigned char ms=0; ms<element->n_neighbors(); ms++)
281  {
282  next_side:
283  // If we haven't yet found a neighbor on this side, try.
284  // Even if we think our neighbor is remote, that
285  // information may be out of date.
286  if (element->neighbor_ptr(ms) == libmesh_nullptr ||
287  element->neighbor_ptr(ms) == remote_elem)
288  {
289  // Get the key for the side of this element
290  const unsigned int key = element->key(ms);
291 
292  // Look for elements that have an identical side key
293  std::pair <map_type::iterator, map_type::iterator>
294  bounds = side_to_elem_map.equal_range(key);
295 
296  // May be multiple keys, check all the possible
297  // elements which _might_ be neighbors.
298  if (bounds.first != bounds.second)
299  {
300  // Get the side for this element
301  const UniquePtr<Elem> my_side(element->side_ptr(ms));
302 
303  // Look at all the entries with an equivalent key
304  while (bounds.first != bounds.second)
305  {
306  // Get the potential element
307  Elem * neighbor = bounds.first->second.first;
308 
309  // Get the side for the neighboring element
310  const unsigned int ns = bounds.first->second.second;
311  const UniquePtr<Elem> their_side(neighbor->side_ptr(ns));
312  //libmesh_assert(my_side.get());
313  //libmesh_assert(their_side.get());
314 
315  // If found a match with my side
316  //
317  // We need special tests here for 1D:
318  // since parents and children have an equal
319  // side (i.e. a node), we need to check
320  // ns != ms, and we also check level() to
321  // avoid setting our neighbor pointer to
322  // any of our neighbor's descendants
323  if( (*my_side == *their_side) &&
324  (element->level() == neighbor->level()) &&
325  ((element->dim() != 1) || (ns != ms)) )
326  {
327  // So share a side. Is this a mixed pair
328  // of subactive and active/ancestor
329  // elements?
330  // If not, then we're neighbors.
331  // If so, then the subactive's neighbor is
332 
333  if (element->subactive() ==
334  neighbor->subactive())
335  {
336  // an element is only subactive if it has
337  // been coarsened but not deleted
338  element->set_neighbor (ms,neighbor);
339  neighbor->set_neighbor(ns,element);
340  }
341  else if (element->subactive())
342  {
343  element->set_neighbor(ms,neighbor);
344  }
345  else if (neighbor->subactive())
346  {
347  neighbor->set_neighbor(ns,element);
348  }
349  side_to_elem_map.erase (bounds.first);
350 
351  // get out of this nested crap
352  goto next_side;
353  }
354 
355  ++bounds.first;
356  }
357  }
358 
359  // didn't find a match...
360  // Build the map entry for this element
361  key_val_pair kvp;
362 
363  kvp.first = key;
364  kvp.second.first = element;
365  kvp.second.second = ms;
366 
367  // use the lower bound as a hint for
368  // where to put it.
369 #if defined(LIBMESH_HAVE_UNORDERED_MAP) || defined(LIBMESH_HAVE_TR1_UNORDERED_MAP) || defined(LIBMESH_HAVE_HASH_MAP) || defined(LIBMESH_HAVE_EXT_HASH_MAP)
370  side_to_elem_map.insert (kvp);
371 #else
372  side_to_elem_map.insert (bounds.first,kvp);
373 #endif
374  }
375  }
376  }
377  }
378 
379 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
380 
408  const unsigned int n_levels = MeshTools::n_levels(*this);
409  for (unsigned int level = 1; level < n_levels; ++level)
410  {
411  element_iterator end = this->level_elements_end(level);
412  for (element_iterator el = this->level_elements_begin(level);
413  el != end; ++el)
414  {
415  Elem * current_elem = *el;
416  libmesh_assert(current_elem);
417  Elem * parent = current_elem->parent();
418  libmesh_assert(parent);
419  const unsigned int my_child_num = parent->which_child_am_i(current_elem);
420 
421  for (unsigned int s=0; s < current_elem->n_neighbors(); s++)
422  {
423  if (current_elem->neighbor_ptr(s) == libmesh_nullptr ||
424  (current_elem->neighbor_ptr(s) == remote_elem &&
425  parent->is_child_on_side(my_child_num, s)))
426  {
427  Elem * neigh = parent->neighbor_ptr(s);
428 
429  // If neigh was refined and had non-subactive children
430  // made remote earlier, then a non-subactive elem should
431  // actually have one of those remote children as a
432  // neighbor
433  if (neigh && (neigh->ancestor()) && (!current_elem->subactive()))
434  {
435 #ifdef DEBUG
436  // Let's make sure that "had children made remote"
437  // situation is actually the case
438  libmesh_assert(neigh->has_children());
439  bool neigh_has_remote_children = false;
440  for (unsigned int c = 0; c != neigh->n_children(); ++c)
441  {
442  if (neigh->child_ptr(c) == remote_elem)
443  neigh_has_remote_children = true;
444  }
445  libmesh_assert(neigh_has_remote_children);
446 
447  // And let's double-check that we don't have
448  // a remote_elem neighboring an active local element
449  if (current_elem->active())
450  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (current_elem->processor_id(),
451  this->processor_id());
452 #endif // DEBUG
453  neigh = const_cast<RemoteElem *>(remote_elem);
454  }
455 
456  if (!current_elem->subactive())
457  current_elem->set_neighbor(s, neigh);
458 #ifdef DEBUG
459  if (neigh != libmesh_nullptr && neigh != remote_elem)
460  // We ignore subactive elements here because
461  // we don't care about neighbors of subactive element.
462  if ((!neigh->active()) && (!current_elem->subactive()))
463  {
464  libMesh::err << "On processor " << this->processor_id()
465  << std::endl;
466  libMesh::err << "Bad element ID = " << current_elem->id()
467  << ", Side " << s << ", Bad neighbor ID = " << neigh->id() << std::endl;
468  libMesh::err << "Bad element proc_ID = " << current_elem->processor_id()
469  << ", Bad neighbor proc_ID = " << neigh->processor_id() << std::endl;
470  libMesh::err << "Bad element size = " << current_elem->hmin()
471  << ", Bad neighbor size = " << neigh->hmin() << std::endl;
472  libMesh::err << "Bad element center = " << current_elem->centroid()
473  << ", Bad neighbor center = " << neigh->centroid() << std::endl;
474  libMesh::err << "ERROR: "
475  << (current_elem->active()?"Active":"Ancestor")
476  << " Element at level "
477  << current_elem->level() << std::endl;
478  libMesh::err << "with "
479  << (parent->active()?"active":
480  (parent->subactive()?"subactive":"ancestor"))
481  << " parent share "
482  << (neigh->subactive()?"subactive":"ancestor")
483  << " neighbor at level " << neigh->level()
484  << std::endl;
485  NameBasedIO(*this).write ("bad_mesh.gmv");
486  libmesh_error_msg("Problematic mesh written to bad_mesh.gmv.");
487  }
488 #endif // DEBUG
489  }
490  }
491 
492  // We can skip to the next element if we're full-dimension
493  // and therefore don't have any interior parents
494  if (current_elem->dim() >= LIBMESH_DIM)
495  continue;
496 
497  // We have no interior parents unless we can find one later
498  current_elem->set_interior_parent(libmesh_nullptr);
499 
500  Elem * pip = parent->interior_parent();
501 
502  if (!pip)
503  continue;
504 
505  // If there's no interior_parent children, whether due to a
506  // remote element or a non-conformity, then there's no
507  // children to search.
508  if (pip == remote_elem || pip->active())
509  {
510  current_elem->set_interior_parent(pip);
511  continue;
512  }
513 
514  // For node comparisons we'll need a sensible tolerance
515  Real node_tolerance = current_elem->hmin() * TOLERANCE;
516 
517  // Otherwise our interior_parent should be a child of our
518  // parent's interior_parent.
519  for (unsigned int c=0; c != pip->n_children(); ++c)
520  {
521  Elem * child = pip->child_ptr(c);
522 
523  // If we have a remote_elem, that might be our
524  // interior_parent. We'll set it provisionally now and
525  // keep trying to find something better.
526  if (child == remote_elem)
527  {
528  current_elem->set_interior_parent
529  (const_cast<RemoteElem *>(remote_elem));
530  continue;
531  }
532 
533  bool child_contains_our_nodes = true;
534  for (unsigned int n=0; n != current_elem->n_nodes();
535  ++n)
536  {
537  bool child_contains_this_node = false;
538  for (unsigned int cn=0; cn != child->n_nodes();
539  ++cn)
540  if (child->point(cn).absolute_fuzzy_equals
541  (current_elem->point(n), node_tolerance))
542  {
543  child_contains_this_node = true;
544  break;
545  }
546  if (!child_contains_this_node)
547  {
548  child_contains_our_nodes = false;
549  break;
550  }
551  }
552  if (child_contains_our_nodes)
553  {
554  current_elem->set_interior_parent(child);
555  break;
556  }
557  }
558 
559  // We should have found *some* interior_parent at this
560  // point, whether semilocal or remote.
561  libmesh_assert(current_elem->interior_parent());
562  }
563  }
564 
565 #endif // AMR
566 
567 
568 #ifdef DEBUG
569  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_neighbors(*this,
570  !reset_remote_elements);
571  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_amr_interior_parents(*this);
572 #endif
573 }
libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_amr_interior_parents
void libmesh_assert_valid_amr_interior_parents(const MeshBase &mesh)
Definition: mesh_tools.C:1179
libMesh::Elem::active
bool active() const
Definition: elem.h:1976

libMesh::libmesh_assert
libmesh_assert(remote_elem)
libmesh_nullptr
const class libmesh_nullptr_t libmesh_nullptr
libMesh::TOLERANCE
static const Real TOLERANCE
Definition: libmesh_common.h:139
end
IterBase * end

libMesh::RemoteElem::is_child_on_side
virtual bool is_child_on_side(const unsigned int, const unsigned int) const libmesh_override
Definition: remote_elem.h:137

Definition: libmesh_common.h:131

void libMesh::DistributedMesh::fix_broken_node_and_element_numbering ( )

There is no reason for a user to ever call this function.

This function restores a previously broken element/node numbering such that mesh.node_ref(n).id() == n.

Elem * libMesh::DistributedMesh::insert_elem ( Elem *  e)
virtual

Insert elem e to the element array, preserving its id and replacing/deleting any existing element with the same id.

Users should call MeshBase::prepare_for_use() after elements are added to and/or deleted from the mesh.

Implements libMesh::MeshBase.

References _elements, _n_elem, libMesh::MeshBase::_next_unique_id, _next_unpartitioned_unique_id, delete_elem(), libMesh::DofObject::id(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_processor_id, libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::set_unique_id(), and libMesh::DofObject::valid_unique_id().

504 {
505  if (_elements[e->id()])
506  this->delete_elem(_elements[e->id()]);
507 
508 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
509  if (!e->valid_unique_id())
510  {
511  if (processor_id() == e->processor_id())
512  {
513  e->set_unique_id() = _next_unique_id;
514  _next_unique_id += this->n_processors() + 1;
515  }
516  else
517  {
518  e->set_unique_id() = _next_unpartitioned_unique_id;
519  _next_unpartitioned_unique_id += this->n_processors() + 1;
520  }
521  }
522 #endif
523 
524  // Try to make the cached elem data more accurate
525  processor_id_type elem_procid = e->processor_id();
526  if (elem_procid == this->processor_id() ||
527  elem_procid == DofObject::invalid_processor_id)
528  _n_elem++;
529 
530  _elements[e->id()] = e;
531 
532  return e;
533 }

template<typename T >
void libMesh::DistributedMesh::libmesh_assert_valid_parallel_object_ids ( const mapvector< T *, dof_id_type > &  objects) const

Verify id, processor_id, and if applicable unique_id consistency of a parallel objects container. Calls libmesh_assert() on each possible failure in that container.

Definition at line 864 of file distributed_mesh.C.

References libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id, libMesh::DofObject::invalid_processor_id, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libmesh_nullptr, std::max(), libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::min(), parallel_max_elem_id(), parallel_max_node_id(), and libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id().

Referenced by libmesh_assert_valid_parallel_ids().

865 {
866  // This function must be run on all processors at once
867  parallel_object_only();
868 
869  const dof_id_type pmax_node_id = this->parallel_max_node_id();
870  const dof_id_type pmax_elem_id = this->parallel_max_elem_id();
871  const dof_id_type pmax_id = std::max(pmax_node_id, pmax_elem_id);
872 
873  for (dof_id_type i=0; i != pmax_id; ++i)
874  {
875  T * obj = objects[i]; // Returns NULL if there's no map entry
876 
877  // Local lookups by id should return the requested object
878  libmesh_assert(!obj || obj->id() == i);
879 
880  // All processors with an object should agree on id
881  const dof_id_type dofid = obj && obj->valid_id() ?
882  obj->id() : DofObject::invalid_id;
883  libmesh_assert(this->comm().semiverify(obj ? &dofid : libmesh_nullptr));
884 
885  // All processors with an object should agree on processor id
886  const dof_id_type procid = obj && obj->valid_processor_id() ?
887  obj->processor_id() : DofObject::invalid_processor_id;
888  libmesh_assert(this->comm().semiverify(obj ? &procid : libmesh_nullptr));
889 
890  dof_id_type min_procid = procid;
891  this->comm().min(min_procid);
892 
893  // Either:
894  // 1.) I own this elem (min_procid == this->processor_id()) *and* I have a valid pointer to it (obj != NULL)
895  // or
896  // 2.) I don't own this elem (min_procid != this->processor_id()). (In this case I may or may not have a valid pointer to it.)
897 
898  // Original assert logic
899  // libmesh_assert (min_procid != this->processor_id() || obj);
900 
901  // More human-understandable logic...
902  libmesh_assert (
903  ((min_procid == this->processor_id()) && obj)
904  ||
905  (min_procid != this->processor_id())
906  );
907 
908 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID
909  // All processors with an object should agree on unique id
910  const unique_id_type uniqueid = obj ? obj->unique_id() : 0;
911  libmesh_assert(this->comm().semiverify(obj ? &uniqueid : libmesh_nullptr));
912 #endif
913  }
914 }

unsigned int libMesh::MeshBase::mesh_dimension ( ) const
inherited
Returns
the logical dimension of the mesh; i.e. the manifold dimension of the elements in the mesh. If we ever support multi-dimensional meshes (e.g. hexes and quads in the same mesh) then this will return the largest such dimension.

virtual dof_id_type libMesh::DistributedMesh::n_elem ( ) const
inlinevirtual

Returns the number of elements in the mesh. The standard n_elem() function may return a cached value on distributed meshes, and so can be called by any processor at any time.

359  // We're either counting a processor's elements or unpartitioned
360  // elements
361  libmesh_assert (proc_id < this->n_processors() ||
362  proc_id == DofObject::invalid_processor_id);
363 
364  return static_cast<dof_id_type>(std::distance (this->pid_elements_begin(proc_id),
365  this->pid_elements_end (proc_id)));
366 }

virtual dof_id_type libMesh::DistributedMesh::n_nodes ( ) const
inlinevirtual

Returns the number of nodes in the mesh. This function and others must be defined in derived classes since the MeshBase class has no specific storage for nodes or elements. The standard n_nodes() function may return a cached value on distributed meshes, and so can be called by any processor at any time.

Implements libMesh::MeshBase.

unsigned int libMesh::MeshBase::n_partitions ( ) const
inlineinherited

Returns the number of partitions which have been defined via a call to either mesh.partition() or by building a Partitioner object and calling partition. Note that the partitioner objects are responsible for setting this value.

dof_id_type libMesh::MeshBase::n_sub_elem ( ) const
inherited

This function returns the number of elements that will be written out in the Tecplot format. For example, a 9-noded quadrilateral will be broken into 4 linear sub-elements for plotting purposes. Thus, for a mesh of 2 QUAD9 elements n_tecplot_elem() will return 8. Implemented in terms of element_iterators.

384  const const_element_iterator end = this->elements_end();
385

387  ne += (*el)->n_sub_elem();
388 
389  return ne;
390 }

Definition: id_types.h:64
subdomain_id_type libMesh::MeshBase::n_subdomains ( ) const
inherited

Returns the number of subdomains in the global mesh. Subdomains correspond to separate subsets of the mesh which could correspond e.g. to different materials in a solid mechanics application, or regions where different physical processes are important. The subdomain mapping is independent from the parallel decomposition.

Definition at line 203 of file distributed_mesh.C.

References _elements, libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), and libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::max().

Referenced by allgather(), libMesh::MeshCommunication::delete_remote_elements(), delete_remote_elements(), libmesh_assert_valid_parallel_flags(), libmesh_assert_valid_parallel_object_ids(), libmesh_assert_valid_parallel_p_levels(), renumber_nodes_and_elements(), and update_parallel_id_counts().

204 {
205  // This function must be run on all processors at once
206  parallel_object_only();
207 
208  dof_id_type max_local = 0;
209 
210  mapvector<Elem *,dof_id_type>::maptype::const_reverse_iterator
211  rit = _elements.rbegin();
212 
213  const mapvector<Elem *,dof_id_type>::maptype::const_reverse_iterator
214  rend = _elements.rend();
215 
216  // Look for the maximum element id. Search backwards through
217  // elements so we can break out early. Beware of NULL entries that
218  // haven't yet been cleared from _elements.
219  for (; rit != rend; ++rit)
220  if (rit->second)
221  {
222  libmesh_assert_equal_to(rit->second->id(), rit->first);
223  max_local = rit->first + 1;
224  break;
225  }
226 
227  this->comm().max(max_local);
228  return max_local;
229 }

dof_id_type libMesh::DistributedMesh::parallel_n_elem ( ) const
virtual

Returns the number of elements in the mesh. The parallel_n_elem() function returns a newly calculated parallel-synchronized value on distributed meshes, and so must be called in parallel only.

Implements libMesh::MeshBase.

Definition at line 190 of file distributed_mesh.C.

dof_id_type libMesh::DistributedMesh::parallel_n_nodes ( ) const
virtual

Returns the number of nodes in the mesh. This function and others must be defined in derived classes since the MeshBase class has no specific storage for nodes or elements. The parallel_n_nodes() function returns a newly calculated parallel-synchronized value on distributed meshes, and so must be called in parallel only.

Implements libMesh::MeshBase.

Definition at line 248 of file distributed_mesh.C.

void libMesh::MeshBase::partition ( const unsigned int  n_parts)
virtualinherited

Call the default partitioner (currently metis_partition()).

Definition at line 457 of file mesh_base.C.

References libMesh::MeshBase::is_serial(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_unpartitioned_elem(), libMesh::MeshBase::partitioner(), libMesh::MeshBase::recalculate_n_partitions(), libMesh::Partitioner::set_node_processor_ids(), libMesh::MeshBase::skip_partitioning(), and libMesh::MeshBase::update_post_partitioning().

458 {
459  // If we get here and we have unpartitioned elements, we need that
460  // fixed.
461  if (this->n_unpartitioned_elem() > 0)
462  {
463  libmesh_assert (partitioner().get());
464  libmesh_assert (this->is_serial());
465  partitioner()->partition (*this, n_parts);
466  }
467  // NULL partitioner means don't repartition
468  // Non-serial meshes may not be ready for repartitioning here.
469  else if(!skip_partitioning() &&
470  partitioner().get())
471  {
472  partitioner()->partition (*this, n_parts);
473  }
474  else
475  {
476  // Adaptive coarsening may have "orphaned" nodes on processors
477  // whose elements no longer share them. We need to check for
478  // and possibly fix that.
479  Partitioner::set_node_processor_ids(*this);
480 
481  // Make sure locally cached partition count
482  this->recalculate_n_partitions();
483 
484  // Make sure any other locally cached data is correct
485  this->update_post_partitioning();
486  }

inherited

returns a pointer to a PointLocatorBase object for this mesh, constructing a master PointLocator first if necessary. This should never be used in threaded or non-parallel_only code, and so is deprecated.

void libMesh::MeshBase::prepare_for_use ( const bool  skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements = false,
const bool  skip_find_neighbors = false 
)
inherited

Prepare a newly created (or read) mesh for use. This involves 4 steps: 1.) call find_neighbors() 2.) call partition() 3.) call renumber_nodes_and_elements() 4.) call cache_elem_dims()

The argument to skip renumbering is now deprecated - to prevent a mesh from being renumbered, set allow_renumbering(false).

If this is a distributed mesh, local copies of remote elements will be deleted here - to keep those elements replicated during preparation, set allow_remote_element_removal(false).

Definition at line 172 of file mesh_base.C.

References libMesh::MeshBase::_allow_remote_element_removal, libMesh::MeshBase::_is_prepared, libMesh::MeshBase::_skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements, libMesh::MeshBase::allow_renumbering(), libMesh::MeshBase::cache_elem_dims(), libMesh::MeshBase::clear_point_locator(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::MeshBase::delete_remote_elements(), libMesh::MeshBase::detect_interior_parents(), libMesh::MeshBase::find_neighbors(), libMesh::MeshBase::ghosting_functors_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::ghosting_functors_end(), libMesh::MeshBase::is_serial(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_boundary_ids(), libMesh::MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_unique_ids(), libMesh::GhostingFunctor::mesh_reinit(), libMesh::MeshBase::partition(), libMesh::MeshBase::renumber_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::MeshBase::update_parallel_id_counts(), and libMesh::Parallel::verify().

Referenced by libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::all_first_order(), libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::all_second_order(), libMesh::MeshTools::Subdivision::all_subdivision(), libMesh::MeshTools::Modification::all_tri(), libMesh::MeshTools::Generation::build_cube(), libMesh::MeshTools::Generation::build_extrusion(), libMesh::InfElemBuilder::build_inf_elem(), libMesh::MeshRefinement::coarsen_elements(), libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::copy_nodes_and_elements(), libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::create_submesh(), libMesh::MeshTools::Modification::flatten(), libMesh::MeshTools::Subdivision::prepare_subdivision_mesh(), libMesh::GMVIO::read(), libMesh::UnstructuredMesh::read(), libMesh::MeshRefinement::refine_and_coarsen_elements(), libMesh::MeshRefinement::refine_elements(), libMesh::ReplicatedMesh::stitching_helper(), libMesh::BoundaryInfo::sync(), libMesh::TriangleInterface::triangulate(), libMesh::MeshRefinement::uniformly_coarsen(), and libMesh::MeshRefinement::uniformly_refine().

173 {
174  parallel_object_only();
175 
176  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(this->is_serial()));
177 
178  // A distributed mesh may have processors with no elements (or
179  // processors with no elements of higher dimension, if we ever
180  // support mixed-dimension meshes), but we want consistent
181  // mesh_dimension anyways.
182  //
183  // cache_elem_dims() should get the elem_dimensions() and
184  // mesh_dimension() correct later, and we don't need it earlier.
185 
186 
187  // Renumber the nodes and elements so that they in contiguous
188  // blocks. By default, _skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements is false.
189  //
190  // We may currently change that by passing
191  // skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements==true to this function, but we
192  // should use the allow_renumbering() accessor instead.
193  //
194  // Instances where you if prepare_for_use() should not renumber the nodes
195  // and elements include reading in e.g. an xda/r or gmv file. In
196  // this case, the ordering of the nodes may depend on an accompanying
197  // solution, and the node ordering cannot be changed.
198 
199  if (skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements)
200  {
201  libmesh_deprecated();
202  this->allow_renumbering(false);
203  }
204 
205  // Mesh modification operations might not leave us with consistent
206  // id counts, but our partitioner might need that consistency.
207  if(!_skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements)
208  this->renumber_nodes_and_elements();
209  else
210  this->update_parallel_id_counts();
211 
212  // Let all the elements find their neighbors
213  if(!skip_find_neighbors)
214  this->find_neighbors();
215 
216  // The user may have set boundary conditions. We require that the
217  // boundary conditions were set consistently. Because we examine
218  // neighbors when evaluating non-raw boundary condition IDs, this
219  // assert is only valid when our neighbor links are in place.
220 #ifdef DEBUG
221  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_boundary_ids(*this);
222 #endif
223 
224  // Search the mesh for all the dimensions of the elements
225  // and cache them.
226  this->cache_elem_dims();
227 
228  // Search the mesh for elements that have a neighboring element
229  // of dim+1 and set that element as the interior parent
230  this->detect_interior_parents();
231 
232  // Fix up node unique ids in case mesh generation code didn't take
233  // exceptional care to do so.
234  // MeshCommunication().make_node_unique_ids_parallel_consistent(*this);
235 
236  // We're going to still require that mesh generation code gets
237  // element unique ids consistent.
238 #if defined(DEBUG) && defined(LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID)
239  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_unique_ids(*this);
240 #endif
241 
242  // Reset our PointLocator. Any old locator is invalidated any time
243  // the elements in the underlying elements in the mesh have changed,
244  // so we clear it here.
245  this->clear_point_locator();
246 
247  // Allow our GhostingFunctor objects to reinit if necessary.
248  // Do this before partitioning and redistributing, and before
249  // deleting remote elements.
250  std::set<GhostingFunctor *>::iterator gf_it = this->ghosting_functors_begin();
251  const std::set<GhostingFunctor *>::iterator gf_end = this->ghosting_functors_end();
252  for (; gf_it != gf_end; ++gf_it)
253  {
254  GhostingFunctor *gf = *gf_it;
255  libmesh_assert(gf);
256  gf->mesh_reinit();
257  }
258 
259  // Partition the mesh.
260  this->partition();
261 
262  // If we're using DistributedMesh, we'll probably want it
263  // parallelized.
264  if (this->_allow_remote_element_removal)
265  this->delete_remote_elements();
266 
267  if(!_skip_renumber_nodes_and_elements)
268  this->renumber_nodes_and_elements();
269 
270  // The mesh is now prepared for use.
271  _is_prepared = true;
272 
273 #if defined(DEBUG) && defined(LIBMESH_ENABLE_UNIQUE_ID)
274  MeshTools::libmesh_assert_valid_unique_ids(*this);
275 #endif
276 }
